qas.question: What is a pinning method that isn't allowed?

answers.text: using the ropes for leverage and hooking the opponent's clothing,

qas.question: How often are illegal pinning methods seen by the referee?

answers.text: Such pins as these are rarely seen by the referee

qas.question: What are the illegal pinning methods called?
Can illegal pinning methods result in being disqualified?

answers.text: it is rare for such an attempt to result in a disqualification

qas.question: What happens with an illegal pinning move when it is seen by a referee?

answers.text: results in nullification of the pin attempt,

context: Illegal pinning methods include <a0_0>using the ropes for leverage and hooking the opponent's clothing,<a0_0/> which are therefore popular cheating methods for heels, unless certain stipulations make such an advantage legal. <a1_0>Such pins as these are rarely seen by the referee<a1_0/> (as they have to see if their shoulders are down) and are subsequently often used by heels and on occasion by <a2_0>cheating<a2_0/> faces to win matches. Even if it is noticed, <a3_0>it is rare for such an attempt to result in a disqualification<a3_0/> (see below), and instead it simply <a4_0>results in nullification of the pin attempt,<a4_0/> so the heel wrestler rarely has anything to lose for trying it, anyway.
